name: 16s ribosomal gene sequencing assay
description: An amplicon sequencing assay in which the amplicon is derived from universal primers used to amplify the 16S ribosomal RNA gene from isolate bacterial genomic DNA or metagenomic DNA from a microbioal community. Resulting sequences are compared to reference 16S sequence databases to identify or classify bacteria present within a given sample.

name: cytokine assay
description: An analyte assay to study presence, concentration, or amount of cytokines.

name: whole metagenome sequencing assay
description: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information on the DNA sequences of multiple genomes (a metagenome) from different organisms present in the same input sample.

name: operational taxonomic unit matrix
description: Operational Taxonomic Unit matrix  is a data item, organized as a table, where organismal taxonomic units, computed by sequence analysis and genetic distance calculation, are counted in a set of biological or environmental samples. The table is  used to appraise biodiversity of a population or community of living organism.\n

name: sequence trimming
description: A data transformation in which subsequences of a molecular sequence are cut (removed).

name: RNA sequencing assay
description: An assay that determines the sequence of an RNA molecule.

name: metabolite profiling assay
description: An assay that detects and identifies chemical entities resulting from biochemical and cellular metabolism

name: sequence assembly process
description: A data transformation that assembles two or more individual sequence reads into contiguous sequences (i.e., contigs).

name: sequence annotation
description: A planned process that identifies and reports sequence features (e.g. protein coding regions) in sequence data.

name: sequence alignment
description: A data transformation in which one or more sequences (reads) are positioned on a reference sequence template (often a reference set of genes), according to the genetic base-pairing paradigm.

name: epigenetic modification assay
description: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.

name: antigen specific antibodies assay
description: An analyte assay that measures the presence or amount of antibodies to a specified antigen.

name: whole genome sequencing assay
description: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of an entire genome of an organism.

name: genotyping by high throughput sequencing assay
description: A genotyping assay that uses a high througput sequencer

name: protein expression profiling assay
description: An assay that determines protein expression and translation activity using protein extracts collected from a material entity.

name: class discovery data transformation
description: A class discovery data transformation (sometimes called unsupervised classification) is a data transformation that has objective class discovery.

name: lipid profiling assay
description: An analyte assay assay that detects and identifies lipids resulting from biochemical and cellular metabolism.
